member.name: M:Abyat.Api.Controllers.Auth.AuthController.Login(Abyat.Bl.Dtos.User.LoginDto)
member.summary: Authenticates a user by validating their credentials and issuing access/refresh tokens.
member.param: The login request containing email and password credentials.
member.returns:
An containing:
200 OK - Returns an access token and refresh token if login is successful.
400 BadRequest - Returned when the model validation fails.
401 Unauthorized - Returned if the login attempt fails due to invalid credentials.
500 InternalServerError - Returned when an unhandled error occurs.
The refresh token is generated and stored in the database for tracking. Additionally, it is returned to the client in a secure HttpOnly cookie. The cookieâ€™s name is defined by the RefreshTokenCookieName field/constant in the controller, and it currently uses a 7-day expiration.
member.remarks: - If the account requires two-factor authentication (2FA), the response will indicate that explicitly. - The access token is included in the response body for client-side use. - The refresh token is persisted in a secure cookie, so clients should read it from there rather than relying on the response body.

member.name: M:Abyat.Api.Controllers.Auth.AuthController.RefreshAccessToken
member.summary: Refreshes the access token using the refresh token stored in cookies.
member.remarks: This endpoint is typically used by clients when their access token expires. The refresh token must be valid, active, and not expired. A new short-lived access token is generated and returned, and also set in cookies.
member.returns:
An representing the result of the operation:
Returns (HTTP 200) with a new access token if the refresh token is valid.
Returns (HTTP 401) if the refresh token is invalid, expired, or missing.

member.name: M:Abyat.Api.Controllers.Auth.AuthController.Refresh
member.summary: Issues a new refresh token, replacing the old one.
member.remarks: This endpoint performs refresh token rotation, which helps reduce the impact of token theft. A new refresh token is generated, persisted in the database, and stored in cookies. The old refresh token becomes invalid immediately.
member.returns:
An representing the result of the operation:
Returns (HTTP 200) with a new refresh token if the old one is valid.
Returns (HTTP 401) if the old refresh token is missing, invalid, or expired.
